title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus VII (March 1360, Chambéry – 1 November 1391), known as the Red Count, was Count of Savoy from 1383 to 1391.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus was the son of Amadeus VI, Count of Savoy and Bonne of Bourbon.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus VII was known for his hospitality, for he would entertain people of all stations and never turned a person from his table without a meal.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: He married Bonne of Berry, daughter of John, Duke of Berry, who was the younger brother of Charles V of France.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: They had three children: Upon his death at age 29 from tetanus, controversy arose because of his will.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: Amadeus VII left the important role of guardian of his son and heir, Amadeus VIII, to his own mother, a sister of the powerful Duke de Bourbon, instead of following the tradition of appointing the child's mother, who was a daughter of the equally powerful Duke de Berry.

title: Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy
text: It took three months of negotiations to restore peace in the family.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: Amadeus VIII( 4 September 1383 – 7 January 1451) was a Savoyard nobleman, the son of Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy and Bonne of Berry.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: He was surnamed the Peaceful.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: After the death of his father in 1391, his mother acted as a regent, because of his youth.

title: Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy
text: He was an antipope of the Catholic Church from 1439 to 1449 as Felix V, in opposition to Popes Eugene IV and Nicholas V.

title: Beatrice of Viennois
text: Beatrice of Vienne( 1160 –1230) was a Countess of Savoy by marriage to Humbert III, Count of Savoy.

title: Yolande Louise of Savoy
text: Yolande Louise of Savoy( 1487–1499), was a Duchess Consort of Savoy; married to Philibert II, Duke of Savoy.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: Joan of Geneva( born c. 1040, died 1095) was a Countess Consort of Savoy; married to Amadeus II, Count of Savoy.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: According to the much later" Chronicles of Savoy", Amadeus married Joan, daughter of" Girard, Count of Burgundy", which scholars have surmised to have been Count Gerold of Geneva.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: The" Chronicon Altacumbae" says only that" the wife of Amadeus from Burgundy", which might refer to Amadeus I.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: If his wife were Genevan, it would explain how the house of Savoy came so early to possess a large portion of the Genevois.

title: Joan of Geneva
text: His wife, whatever her name and origins, bore Amadeus II several children, although there is some uncertainty about how many:

title: Humbert II, Count of Savoy
text: Umberto II, nicknamed the Fat( 1065, Carignano, Piedmont – 19 October 1103), was Count of Savoy from 1080 until his death in 1103.

title: Humbert II, Count of Savoy
text: He was the son of Amadeus II of Savoy.

title: Humbert II, Count of Savoy
text: He was married to Gisela of Burgundy, daughter of William I, Count of Burgundy, and had 7 children:

title: Cecile of Baux
text: Cecile of Baux( 1230 – 1275), was a Countess Consort of Savoy; married in 1244 to Amadeus IV, Count of Savoy.

title: Cecile of Baux
text: She was the daughter of Barral of Baux and his wife, Sibylle d'Anduze.

title: Cecile of Baux
text: She was the Regent of Savoy during the minority of her son, Boniface, Count of Savoy, from 1253 until 1259.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: Louis( 1364 – 11 December 1418) was the Lord of Piedmont and titular Prince of Achaea from 1402.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: He was a son of James of Piedmont and Marguerite de Beaujeu( 1346 – 1402).

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: In 1405, he founded the University of Turin.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: On 24 January 1403, he married Bona( 1388 – 1432), daughter of Amadeus VII, Count of Savoy, but they never had any children.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: When he died in 1418, the Piedmont- Achaea cadet branch of the House of Savoy died with him.

title: Louis of Piedmont
text: His titles and estates were inherited by the senior line of the House of Savoy.

title: Bonne of Bourbon
text: Bonne of Bourbon (1341 – 19 January 1402) was a daughter of Peter I, Duke of Bourbon, and Isabella of Valois, and hence a sister of Joanna of Bourbon.

title: Bonne of Bourbon
text: She served as regent of Savoy during the absence of her spouse from 1366 to 1367, in 1383, and during the minority of her grandson Count Amadeus VIII in 1391.

title: Marie of Savoy, Duchess of Milan
text: Marie of Savoy( 1411–1469) was a daughter of Amadeus VIII, Duke of Savoy( later the Antipope Felix V) and Mary of Burgundy.

title: Marie of Savoy, Duchess of Milan
text: She married Filippo Maria Visconti, the Duke of Milan in 1428.

title: Marie of Savoy, Duchess of Milan
text: They had no children.

title: Control engineering
text: Control engineering or control systems engineering is an engineering discipline that applies automatic control theory to design systems with desired behaviors in control environments.

title: Control engineering
text: The discipline of controls overlaps and is usually taught along with electrical engineering at many institutions around the world.

title: Control engineering
text: The practice uses sensors and detectors to measure the output performance of the process being controlled; these measurements are used to provide corrective feedback helping to achieve the desired performance.

title: Control engineering
text: Systems designed to perform without requiring human input are called automatic control systems( such as cruise control for regulating the speed of a car).

title: Control engineering
text: Multi-disciplinary in nature, control systems engineering activities focus on implementation of control systems mainly derived by mathematical modeling of a diverse range of systems.

title: Information Control Systems
text: Information Control Systems( founded in 1962) was a computer programming and data processing company serving clients in the Midwestern United States.

title: Measurex
text: Measurex was an American company based in Cupertino, California.

title: Measurex
text: It was one of the first companies to develop computer control systems for industry, primarily the paper- making industry.

title: Measurex
text: The development of the control systems included the development of control software, and development of scanning sensors to measure different properties of paper.

title: Measurex
text: The company was acquired by Honeywell in at a price tag of almost

title: Measurex
text: At the acquisition, Measurex had 2,250 employees in 30 countries and revenue of$ 254 million.

title: Telus
text: Telus Communications( stylized as TELUS) is a Canadian national telecommunications company that provides a wide range of telecommunications products and services including internet access, voice, entertainment, healthcare, video, and IPTV television.

title: Telus
text: The company is based in the Vancouver, British Columbia area; it was originally based in Edmonton, Alberta, before its merger with BC Tel in 1999.

title: Telus
text: Telus' wireless division, Telus Mobility, offers HSPA+, and LTE- based mobile phone networks.

title: Telus
text: Telus is the incumbent local exchange carrier in British Columbia and Alberta.

title: Telus
text: Telus' primary competitors are Shaw Communications( in the western provinces).

title: Telus
text: It also competes in the mobile sector with Rogers Communications, Bell Canada and Vidéotron( in Quebec).

title: Telus
text: Telus is a member of the British Columbia Technology Industry Association.

title: Farouk Shami
text: Farouk Shami is an American businessman and founder of the hair- care and spa products company, Farouk Systems located in Texas.

title: Farouk Shami
text: In 2009, Shami ran in the 2010 Texas gubernatorial election.

title: Tom, Dick & Harry Creative Co.
text: Tom, Dick & Harry Creative, Co. is an American advertising agency in Chicago, Illinois that creates integrated marketing communications programs for both businesses and not-for-profit organizations.

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: The IEEE Control Systems Award is a technical field award given to an individual by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers( IEEE)" for outstanding contributions to control systems engineering, science or technology".

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: It is an IEEE- level award, created in 1980 by the Board of Directors of the IEEE, but sponsored by the IEEE Control Systems Society.

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: Originally the name was IEEE Control Systems Science and Engineering Award, but after 1991 the IEEE changed it to" IEEE Control Systems Award".

title: IEEE Control Systems Award
text: Recipients of this award receive a bronze medal, a certificate, and an honorarium.

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: The IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology is published bimonthly by the IEEE Control Systems Society.

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: The journal publishes papers, letters, tutorials, surveys, and perspectives on control systems technology.

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: The editor- in- chief is Prof. Andrea Serrani( The Ohio State University).

title: IEEE Transactions on Control Systems Technology
text: According to the" Journal Citation Reports", the journal has a 2017 impact factor of 3.882.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: Digital model railway control systems are an alternative to control a layout and simplify the wiring and add more flexibility in operations.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: A number of control systems are available to operate locomotives on model railways.

title: Digital model railway control systems
text: Analog systems where the speed and the direction of a train is controlled by adjusting the voltage on the track are still popular while they have recently given way to control systems based on computer technology.

title: ZTR Control Systems
text: ZTR Control Systems is a privately held company based in London, Ontario, Canada and with an office in Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA.

title: ZTR Control Systems
text: ZTR provides monitoring and control systems for the railway and industrial off- road compact construction equipment markets.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Sir Alfred Joseph Hitchcock,( 13 August 1899 – 29 April 1980) was an English film director and producer, widely regarded as one of the most influential and extensively studied filmmakers in the history of cinema.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Known as" the Master of Suspense", he directed over 50 feature films in a career spanning six decades, becoming as well known as any of his actors thanks to his many interviews, his cameo roles in most of his films, and his hosting and producing of the television anthology" Alfred Hitchcock Presents"( 1955 – 1965).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: His films garnered a total of 46 Oscar nominations and six wins.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Born in Leytonstone, Essex, Hitchcock entered the film industry in 1919 as a title card designer after training as a technical clerk and copy writer for a telegraph- cable company.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: He made his directorial debut with the silent film" The Pleasure Garden"( 1925).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: His first successful film,( 1927), helped to shape the thriller genre, while his 1929 film," Blackmail", was the first British.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: Two of his 1930s thrillers," The 39 Steps"( 1935) and" The Lady Vanishes"( 1938), are ranked among the greatest British films of the 20th century.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 1939 Hitchcock was a filmmaker of international importance, and film producer David O. Selznick persuaded him to move to Hollywood.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: A string of successful films followed, including" Rebecca"( 1940)," Foreign Correspondent"( 1940)," Suspicion"( 1941)," Shadow of a Doubt"( 1943), and" Notorious"( 1946).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: " Rebecca" won the Academy Award for Best Picture, although Hitchcock himself was only nominated as Best Director; he was also nominated for" Lifeboat"( 1944) and" Spellbound"( 1945), although he never won the Best Director Academy Award.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: The" Hitchcockian" style includes the use of camera movement to mimic a person's gaze, thereby turning viewers into voyeurs, and framing shots to maximise anxiety and fear.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: The film critic Robin Wood wrote that the meaning of a Hitchcock film" is there in the method, in the progression from shot to shot.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: A Hitchcock film is an organism, with the whole implied in every detail and every detail related to the whole."

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: After a brief lull of commercial success in the late 1940s, Hitchcock returned to form with" Strangers on a Train"( 1951) and" Dial M For Murder"( 1954).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 1960 Hitchcock had directed four films often ranked among the greatest of all time:" Rear Window"( 1954)," Vertigo"( 1958)," North by Northwest"( 1959), and" Psycho"( 1960) with the first and last of these garnering him Best Director nominations.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: In 2012," Vertigo" replaced Orson Welles's" Citizen Kane"( 1941) as the British Film Institute's greatest film ever made based on its world- wide poll of hundreds of film critics.

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: By 2018 eight of his films had been selected for preservation in the United States National Film Registry, including his personal favourite," Shadow of a Doubt"( 1943).

title: Alfred Hitchcock
text: He received the BAFTA Fellowship in 1971, the AFI Life Achievement Award in 1979 and was knighted in December that year, four months before he died.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: Marius is a 1931 French drama film directed by Alexander Korda.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: It is based on the play with the same title by Marcel Pagnol.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film is a part of a trilogy which includes the films" Fanny"( Marius's ex-fiancée) and" César"( Marius's father).

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film was selected to be screened in the Cannes Classics section of the 2015 Cannes Film Festival.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The restored film was also given a limited re-release in the United States by Janus Films on 4 January 2017, first premiering at Film Forum.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: The film was made by Korda for the French subsidiary of Paramount Pictures.

title: Marius (1931 film)
text: A separate Swedish- language version" Längtan till havet" by John W. Brunius was also released in 1931 and a German- language version" The Golden Anchor", also directed by Korda, was released the following year.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Dial M for Murder is a 1954 American crime mystery film directed by Alfred Hitchcock, starring Ray Milland, Grace Kelly, Robert Cummings, and John Williams.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Both the screenplay and the successful stage play on which it was based were written by English playwright Frederick Knott.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: The play premiered in 1952 on BBC Television, before being performed on stage in the same year in London's West End in June, and then New York's Broadway in October.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: Originally intended to be shown in dual- strip polarized 3- D, the film played in most theatres in ordinary 2- D due to the loss of interest in the 3- D process( the projection of which was difficult and error- prone) by the time of its release.

title: Dial M for Murder
text: The film earned an estimated$ 2.7 million in North American box office rentals in 1954.

title: New Year (1989 film)
text: " New Year" is a 1989 Malayalam movie which was a remake of 1985 Hindi movie" Aitbaar" which itself was a remake of Alfred Hitchcock's classic murder mystery" Dial M for Murder".

title: Alexander Korda
text: Sir Alexander Korda( born Sándor László Kellner, 16 September 1893 – 23 January 1956) was a British film producer and director and screenwriter, who founded his own film production studios and film distribution company.

title: Alexander Korda
text: Born in Hungary, where he began his career, he worked briefly in the Austrian and German film industries during the era of silent films, before being based in Hollywood from 1926 to 1930 for the first of his two brief periods there( the other was during World War II).

title: Alexander Korda
text: The change led to a divorce from his first wife, the Hungarian film actress María Corda, who was unable to make the transition from silent films to" talkies" because of her strong Hungarian accent.

title: Alexander Korda
text: From 1930, Korda was active in the British film industry, and soon became one of its leading figures.

title: Alexander Korda
text: He was the founder of London Films and, post-war, the owner of British Lion Films, a film distribution company.

title: Alexander Korda
text: Korda produced many outstanding classics of the British film industry, including" The Private Life of Henry VIIIRembrandtThings To Come The Thief of Baghdad" and" The Third Man".

title: Alexander Korda
text: In 1942, Korda became the first filmmaker to receive a knighthood.

text: In a career that spanned more than six decades, Hackman won two Academy Awards, four Golden Globes, one Screen Actors Guild Award, and two BAFTAs.

title: Gene Hackman
text: Nominated for five Academy Awards, Hackman won Best Actor for his role as Jimmy" Popeye" Doyle in the critically acclaimed thriller" The French Connection"( 1971), and Best Supporting Actor as" Little" Bill Daggett in the Clint Eastwood Western" Unforgiven"( 1992).

title: Gene Hackman
text: His other nominations for Best Supporting Actor came with the films" Bonnie and Clyde"( 1967) and" I Never Sang for My Father"( 1970), with a second Best Actor nomination for" Mississippi Burning"( 1988).

title: Gene Hackman
text: Hackman's other major film roles included" The Poseidon Adventure"( 1972)," The Conversation"( 1974)," French Connection II"( 1975)," Superman: The Movie"( 1978) — as arch-villain Lex Luthor —" Hoosiers"( 1986)," The Firm"( 1993)," Crimson Tide"( 1995)," Enemy of the State"( 1998)," Behind Enemy Lines"( 2001)," The Royal Tenenbaums( 2001)", and" Welcome to Mooseport"( 2004).

title: This Is My Father
text: This Is My Father is a 1998 film directed by Paul Quinn.

title: Gilbert Cates
text: Gilbert "Gil" Cates (né Katz; June 6, 1934 – October 31, 2011) was an American film director and television producer, director of the Geffen Playhouse, and founding dean of the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.

title: Gilbert Cates
text: Cates is most known for having produced the Academy Awards telecast a record 14 times between 1990 and 2008.<ref name="LAT2011/11"> </ref

title: Vivian Matalon
text: Vivian Matalon( 11 October 1929 – 15 August 2018) was a British theatre director.

title: Vivian Matalon
text: Born in Manchester, Matalon began his career as an actor in a series of forgettable British films, but his greatest success has been as a director of West End, Broadway and regional theatre productions.

title: Vivian Matalon
text: His West End credits include" Bus Stop" with Lee Remick and Keir Dullea," I Never Sang for My Father" with Raymond Massey and" The Glass Menagerie" with Anna Massey.

title: Vivian Matalon
text: He was artistic director for three years at the Hampstead Theatre, where his productions included Clifford Odets'" Awake and Sing" and the European premiere of" Small Craft Warnings" by Tennessee Williams.

title: Vivian Matalon
text: Matalon served on the Artistic Advisory Board of New York City's New World's Theatre Project, which makes late 19th and early 20th century Yiddish plays accessible to contemporary audiences in modern English translations.

title: Ruth Stiles Gannett
text: Ruth Stiles Gannett Kahn( born August 12, 1923) is an American children's writer best known for" My Father's Dragon" and its two sequels — collectively sometimes called the My Father's Dragon or the Elmer and the Dragons series or trilogy.

title: Rob Reiner
text: Robert Reiner( born March 6, 1947) is an American actor and filmmaker.

title: Rob Reiner
text: As an actor, Reiner first came to national prominence with the role of Michael Stivic on" All in the Family"( 1971 – 1979), a role that earned him two Emmy Awards during the 1970s.

title: Rob Reiner
text: As a director, Reiner was recognized by the Directors Guild of America( DGA) with nominations for the coming of age drama film" Stand by Me"( 1986), the romantic comedy" When Harry Met Sally ..."( 1989), and the military courtroom drama" A Few Good Men"( 1992).

title: Rob Reiner
text: He also directed the psychological horror- thriller" Misery"( 1990), the romantic comedy fantasy adventure" The Princess Bride"( 1987), and the heavy metal mockumentary" This Is Spinal Tap"( 1984).

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: The Princess Bride is a 1987 American fantasy adventure comedy film directed and co-produced by Rob Reiner, starring Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Mandy Patinkin, Chris Sarandon, Wallace Shawn, André the Giant, and Christopher Guest.

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: Adapted by William Goldman from his 1973 novel" The Princess Bride", it tells the story of a farmhand named

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: Westley, accompanied by companions befriended along the way, who must rescue his true love Princess Buttercup from the odious Prince Humperdinck.

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: The film essentially preserves the novel's narrative style by presenting the story as a book being read by a grandfather( Peter Falk) to his sick grandson( Fred Savage).

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: The film was first released in the United States on September 25, 1987, and was well- received by critics at the time, but was only a modest box office success.

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: Over time, particularly with the introduction of the Internet, the film has become a cult classic.

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: The film is number 50 on the Bravo's" 100 Funniest Movies", number 88 on The American Film Institute's( AFI)" AFI's 100 Years ... 100 Passions" list of the 100 greatest film love stories, and 46 in Channel 4's 50 Greatest Comedy Films list.

title: The Princess Bride (film)
text: In 2016, the film was inducted into the National Film Registry, being deemed as" culturally, historically or aesthetically significant".

title: I Never Sang for My Father
text: I Never Sang for My Father is a 1970 American drama film based on a 1968 play of the same name, which tells the story of a widowed college professor who wants to get out from under the thumb of his aging father yet still has regrets about his plan to leave him behind when he remarries and moves to California.

title: I Never Sang for My Father
text: It stars Melvyn Douglas, Gene Hackman, Dorothy Stickney, Estelle Parsons, and Elizabeth Hubbard.

title: I Never Sang for My Father
text: The film was directed and produced by Gilbert Cates, and adapted by Robert Anderson from his 1968 Broadway play.

title: I Never Sang for My Father
text: It was nominated for Academy Awards for Best Actor in a Leading Role( Melvyn Douglas), Best Actor in a Supporting Role( Gene Hackman), and Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium( Robert Anderson).

title: Melvyn Douglas
text: Melvyn Douglas( born Melvyn Edouard Hesselberg, April 5, 1901 – August 4, 1981) was an American actor.

title: Melvyn Douglas
text: Douglas came to prominence in the 1930s as a suave leading man, perhaps best typified by his performance in the 1939 romantic comedy" Ninotchka" with Greta Garbo.

title: Melvyn Douglas
text: Douglas later played mature and fatherly characters, as in his Academy Award – winning performances in" Hud"( 1963) and" Being There"( 1979) and his Academy Award – nominated performance in" I Never Sang for My Father"( 1970).

title: Melvyn Douglas
text: In the last few years of his life Douglas appeared in films with supernatural stories involving ghosts.

title: Melvyn Douglas
text: Douglas appeared as" Senator Joseph Carmichael" in" The Changeling" in 1980 and" Ghost Story" in 1981 in his final completed film role.

title: Prince Igor Constantinovich of Russia
text: Prince Igor Constantinovich of Russia(" Игорь Константинович"; 10 June 1894 – 18 July 1918) was the sixth child of Grand Duke Constantine Constantinovich of Russia by his wife Elisaveta Mavrikievna née Princess Elisabeth of Saxe- Altenburg.

title: Princess Elisabeth of Saxe-Altenburg (1865–1927)
text: Elizabeth Mavrikievna ("née" Princess Elisabeth Auguste Marie Agnes of Saxe-Altenburg; 25 January 1865 – 24 March 1927) was a Russian Grand Duchess by marriage.

title: Princess Elisabeth of Saxe-Altenburg (1865–1927)
text: She was the wife of Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich of Russia (1858–1915), whom she married in 1884 in Saint Petersburg, Russia.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Etan Boritzer( born 1950) is an American writer of children ’s literature who is best known for his book" What is God?" first published in 1989.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His best selling" What is?" illustrated children's book series on character education and difficult subjects for children is a popular teaching guide for parents, teachers and child- life professionals.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer gained national critical acclaim after" What is God?" was published in 1989 although the book has caused controversy from religious fundamentalists for its universalist views.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The other current books in the" What is?" series include

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Love?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Death?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Beautiful?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Funny?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Right?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Peace?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Money?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is Dreaming?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Friend?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is True?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Family?,

title: Etan Boritzer
text: What is a Feeling?"

title: Etan Boritzer
text: The series is now also translated into 15 languages.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer was first published in 1963 at the age of 13 when he wrote an essay in his English class at Wade Junior High School in the Bronx, New York on the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: His essay was included in a special anthology by New York City public school children compiled and published by the New York City Department of Education.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer now lives in Venice, California and maintains his publishing office there also.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He has helped numerous other authors to get published through" How to Get Your Book Published!" programs.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: Boritzer is also a yoga teacher who teaches regular classes locally and guest- teaches nationally.

title: Etan Boritzer
text: He is also recognized nationally as an erudite speaker on" The Teachings of the Buddha."

title: Thomas Scott (diver)
text: Thomas Scott( 1907- date of death unknown) was an English diver.

title: Grand Duke Nicholas Konstantinovich of Russia
text: Grand Duke Nicholas Constantinovich of Russia( 14 February 1850 – 26 January 1918) was the first- born son of Grand Duke Konstantin Nikolayevich and Grand Duchess Alexandra Iosifovna of Russia and a grandson of Nicholas I of Russia.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia(" Константин Константинович"; 1 January 1891 – 18 July 1918), nicknamed Kostya by the family, was the fourth child of Grand Duke Constantine Constantinovich of Russia by his wife Grand Duchess Elizabeth Mavrikievna of Russia.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: The Prince was a silent, shy person who fancied theatre and was educated in the Corps des Pages, a military academy in Saint Petersburg.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: He served in the army during the First World War.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: A priest who met him at the front, Hegumen Seraphim, wrote:" He was an extremely modest officer of the Guard of the Izmaylovsky Regiment, much beloved by officers and soldiers alike; along with them he was a brave soldier who distinguished himself.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: I personally remember seeing him in the trenches among the soldiers, risking his life."

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: After seeing the happiness of his two elder siblings, John and Tatiana, Konstantin was keen to start his own family.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: He fancied the Tsar's oldest daughter, Olga, but was also keen on Princess Elisabeth of Romania.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: Elisabeth's grandmother, the former Grand Duchess Maria Alexandrovna of Russia, wrote to her daughter, the Crown Princess Marie of Romania in 1911, saying," The young Kostya is seized now with terror that she will be snatched away, as he says, before he has even made her acquaintance.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: The young man seems really quite nice, is much liked in his regiment, and they have really been very well brought up.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: This one is full of life ... if you have nothing against this youth coming on a passing visit, will you telegraph to me."

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: However, the request was denied on political grounds, as Prince John was married to Helen of Serbia, and Konstantin never did find the marriage he longed for.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: In March 1918 he was exiled to the Urals by the Bolsheviks and murdered in a mineshaft near Alapayevsk, along with his brothers Prince John Constantinovich and Prince Igor Konstantinovich, his cousin Prince Vladimir Pavlovich Paley and other relatives and friends.

title: Prince Constantine Constantinovich of Russia
text: His body was eventually buried in the Russian Orthodox Church cemetery in Beijing, which was destroyed in 1986 to build a park.

title: Theodred II (Bishop of Elmham)
text: Theodred II was a medieval Bishop of Elmham.

title: Theodred II (Bishop of Elmham)
text: The date of Theodred's consecration unknown, but the date of his death was sometime between 995 and 997.

title: Prince John Konstantinovich of Russia
text: Prince Ioann Konstantinovich of Russia (5 July 1886 – 18 July 1918), sometimes also known as Prince John, Prince Ivan or Prince Johan, was the eldest son of Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich of Russia by his wife Yelizaveta Mavrikievna, née Princess Elisabeth of Saxe-Altenburg.

title: Prince John Konstantinovich of Russia
text: He was described by contemporaries as a gentle, religious person, nicknamed "Ioannchik" by his relatives.

title: Abdul-Vahed Niyazov
text: ' of Russia.

title: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia
text: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia( 15 July

title: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia
text: 1887 – 28 February 1955) was the second son of Grand Duke Konstantin Konstantinovich of Russia and his wife, Grand Duchess Elizabeth Mavrikievna of Russia.

title: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia
text: A great- grandson of Tsar Nicholas I, he was born in Imperial Russia and served in the army during World War I.

title: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia
text: He lost much of his family during the war and the Russian Revolution.

title: Prince Gabriel Constantinovich of Russia
text: He narrowly escaped execution by the Bolsheviks and spent the rest of his life living in exile in France.

title: Theodoric the Great
text: Theodoric the Great (454 – 30 August 526), also spelled Theoderic or called Theodoric the Amal , was king of the Ostrogoths (471–526), and ruler of the independent Ostrogothic Kingdom of Italy between 493–526, regent of the Visigoths (511–526), and a patrician of the Roman Empire.

title: Theodoric the Great
text: As ruler of the combined Gothic realms, Theodoric controlled an empire stretching from the Atlantic Ocean to the Adriatic Sea.

title: Theodoric the Great
text: He kept good relations between Ostrogoths and Romans, maintained a Roman legal administration and oversaw a flourishing scholarly culture as well as overseeing a significant building program across Italy.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: Baglan Mailybayev( in Kazakh Бағлан Асаубайұлы Майлыбаев) was born on 20 May 1975 in Zhambyl region, Kazakhstan.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: His nationality is Kazakh.

title: Baglan Mailybayev
text: He is a politician of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration of the Republic of Kazakhstan, Doctor of Law( 2002)( under the supervision of Professor Zimanov S.Z.- scientific advisor and academician of National Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Kazakhstan) and Ph.D. in Political Science( 1998).

title: Eleni Gabre-Madhin
text: Eleni Zaude Gabre- Madhin, an Ethiopian economist with Swiss nationality, is a former Chief Executive Officer of the Ethiopia Commodity Exchange( ECX).

title: Eleni Gabre-Madhin
text: She has had many years of experience working on agricultural markets – particularly in Sub- Saharan Africa – and has held senior positions in the World Bank, the International Food Policy Research Institute( Washington), and United Nations( Geneva).

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Nayelly Hernández( born 23 February 1986) is a former Mexican female professional squash player.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: She has represented Mexico internationally in several international competitions including the Central American and Caribbean Games, Pan American Games, Women's World Team Squash Championships.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Nayelly achieved her highest career ranking of 57 in October 2011 during the 2011 PSA World Tour.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: Her husband Chris Walker whose nationality is English is also a professional squash player.

title: Nayelly Hernández
text: She joined the Trinity College in 2008 as the first Mexican female to join a US college for squash and graduated in 2010.

title: Fulco
text: Fulco was the first known missionary Bishop of Estonia.

title: Fulco
text: He was appointed in 1165 by Eskil, the Danish Archbishop of Lund.

title: Fulco
text: Before his appointment, Fulco was a Benedictine monk in the abbey of Moutier- la- Celle, near Troyes in France.

title: Fulco
text: His nationality is not known.

title: Fulco
text: After his appointment, Fulco appears in sources only once.

title: Fulco
text: In 1171, Pope Alexander III asked the Archbishop of Trondheim to assign an Estonian monk Nicolaus living in Stavanger to go to Fulco's assistance.

title: Fulco
text: No further information survives about Fulco's work in Estonia, or whether he ever even got there.

title: Roberto Savio
text: Roberto Savio( born in Rome, Italy, but also holding Argentine nationality) is a journalist, communication expert, political commentator, activist for social and climate justice and advocate of global governance.

title: Roberto Savio
text: He has spent most of his career with Inter Press Service( IPS), the news agency which he founded in 1964 along with Argentine journalist Pablo Piacentini.

title: Roberto Savio
text: Savio studied Economics at the University of Parma, followed by post -graduate courses in Development Economics under Gunnar Myrdal, History of Art and International Law in Rome.

title: Roberto Savio
text: He started his professional career as a research assistant in International Law at the University of Parma.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: Khalid al- Habib also believed to use the nom de guerre Khalid al Harbi is an Al- Qaeda leader who has overseen Al- Qaeda operations in Afghanistan.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: In 2005 it was reported that al- Habib died in a US missile strike on the Pakistani village of Damadola though it is unclear whether this is the case as Pakistani officials have claimed that no Al- Qaeda leaders died in the attack.

title: Khalid al-Habib
text: al- Habib's nationality is not clear with sources claiming he may be Egyptian or Moroccan.

title: Audofleda
text: Audofleda was a Gothic queen.

title: Audofleda
text: She was the sister of Clovis I, King of the Franks.

title: Audofleda
text: She married Theoderic the Great, King of the Ostrogoths (471–526), around 493 AD (exact date unknown).

title: Audofleda
text: Theoderic sent an embassy to Clovis to request the marriage.

title: Audofleda
text: This political move allied Theoderic with the Franks, and by marrying his daughters off to the kings of the Burgundians, the Vandals, and the Visigoths, he allied himself with every major 'Barbarian' kingdom in the West.

title: Audofleda
text: Audofleda was a pagan prior to her marriage, and was baptised at the time of her wedding by an Arian bishop.

title: Audofleda
text: Theoderic and Audofleda had one daughter, Amalasuntha, who ruled the Ostrogoths from 526 until 534.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Saint Rumbold( or" RumoldRomuold") was an Irish or Scottish Christian missionary, although his true nationality is not known for certain.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: He was martyred near Mechelen by two men, whom he had denounced for their evil ways.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Saint Rumbold's feast day is celebrated by the Roman Catholic Church, and Western Rite Orthodox Churches, on 24 June; and it is celebrated in Ireland on 3 July.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: He is the patron saint of Mechelen, where St. Rumbold's Cathedral possesses an elaborate golden shrine on its high altar, containing relics attributed to the saint.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: It is rumoured that his remains are buried inside the cathedral.

title: Rumbold of Mechelen
text: Twenty- five paintings in the choir illustrate his life.

title: Ali Rahuma
text: Ali Khalifa Rahuma( born May 16, 1982) is a Libyan football midfielder who's nationality is Libyan.

title: Ali Rahuma
text: He currently plays for Al- Ittihad, and is a member of the Libya national football team.

title: Benjamin King (actor)

title: Letter from the Dead

text: He graduated from the Norwegian Film School at Lillehammer in 2004.

title: Hisham Zaman
text: He has made several award-winning short films, most notably "Bawke" which has received more than 20 national and international awards.

title: Lily King
text: Lily King( born 1963) is an American novelist.

title: Snowman (band)
text: Snowman were a band originally from Perth, Western Australia.

title: Snowman (band)
text: They relocated to London in 2008, and disbanded in 2011.

title: Jessamine (band)
text: Jessamine was an American post- rock band, that recorded three albums for Kranky records between 1994 and 1998, and a number of singles for other record labels.

title: Jessamine (band)
text: These singles were later collected by the band on a self- released compilation album in 1997 entitled" Another Fictionalized History".

title: Jessamine (band)
text: Their single" Cellophane" was a minor college radio hit in the band's native Seattle, getting frequent airplay on KCMU( now KEXP).

title: Jessamine (band)
text: The band's sound was influenced by the works of Krautrock bands such as Can and Neu!, and their first album also bore some sonic resemblance to the sounds of early 1990s bands from the UK shoegaze scene.

title: Jessamine (band)
text: This mesh of krautrock, shoegaze, drone, space- rock, and experimental electronica helped the band forge a unique sound, which helped them stand apart from other active bands in the Seattle scene that were more grunge, metal, or indie- rock based.

title: Jessamine (band)
text: Their success in solidifying a unique sound however did not translate to album sales, and the band remained a relatively obscure act, with a small cult following.

title: Jessamine (band)
text: The band split in 1998, and Ritter and Brown recorded together as Fontanelle for a couple more years.

title: Contra (band)
text: Contra is a band from Cleveland.

text: It's an all female band and they play punk- rock and pop influenced music.

text: He was one of the best friends of Bon Scott the singer of AC/ DC and together they recorded the song" Ride On" which was one of the last songs by Bon Scott.

title: God (John Lennon song)

text: The album was released on 11 December 1970 in the United States and the United Kingdom.

title: O Valencia!

title: O Valencia!
text: The Decemberists, and the first released from their fourth studio album," The Crane Wife".

title: O Valencia!
text: The music was written by The Decemberists and the lyrics by Colin Meloy.

title: O Valencia!

title: O Valencia!

title: O Valencia!

text: He is the singer and- occasionally- guitarist and bassist of crossover thrash band M.O.D., and he was also the singer of its predecessor, Stormtroopers of Death.

title: Billy Milano
text: He was also the singer of United Forces, which also featured his Stormtroopers of Death bandmate Dan Lilker.

title: Panda (Astro song)

title: Panda (Astro song)
text: The song was composed and produced by the singer of the band Andrés Nusser and released like third single of the album on February 1, 2013.

title: Margaret of the Mother of God
text: Margaret of the Mother of God, born Margriet van Noort( 1587 – 1646), was a Dutch Discalced Carmelite lay sister in the Brussels Carmel.

title: Astrid North
text: Astrid North( Astrid Karina North Radmann; 24 August 1973, Berlin – 25 June 2019, Berlin) was a German soul singer and songwriter.

title: Astrid North
text: She was the singer of the German band, with whom she released five Albums.

title: Astrid North
text: As guest singer of the band she published three albums.

title: John Lennon
text: John Winston Ono Lennon (born John Winston Lennon, 9 October 19408 December 1980) was an English singer, songwriter and peace activist who gained worldwide fame as the founder, co-lead vocalist, and rhythm guitarist of the Beatles.

title: John Lennon
text: His songwriting partnership with Paul McCartney remains the most successful in history.

title: John Lennon
text: In 1969, he started the Plastic Ono Band with his second wife, Yoko Ono.

title: John Lennon
text: After the Beatles disbanded in 1970, Lennon continued as a solo artist.

title: John Lennon
text: Born in Liverpool, Lennon became involved in the skiffle craze as a teenager.

title: John Lennon
text: In 1957, he formed his first band, the Quarrymen, which evolved into the Beatles in 1960.

title: John Lennon
text: He was initially the group's de facto leader, a role gradually ceded to McCartney.

title: John Lennon
text: Starting in 1967, Lennon's lyrics began to espouse a pacifist message, and some of his songs were soon adopted as anthems by the anti-war movement and the larger counterculture.

title: John Lennon
text: From 1968 to 1972, he produced more than a dozen records with Ono, including a trilogy of avant-garde albums, his first solo LP "John Lennon/Plastic Ono Band", and the international top 10 singles "Give Peace a ChanceInstant Karma!Imagine" and "Happy Xmas (War Is Over)".

title: John Lennon
text: Lennon was known for the rebellious nature and acerbic wit in his music, writing, drawings, on film and in interviews.

title: John Lennon
text: He was controversial through his political and peace activism.

title: John Lennon
text: After moving to New York City in 1971, his criticism of the Vietnam War resulted in a three-year attempt by the Nixon administration to deport him.

title: John Lennon
text: In 1975, Lennon disengaged from the music business to raise his infant son Sean, and in 1980, returned with the Ono collaboration "Double Fantasy".

title: John Lennon
text: He was shot and killed in the archway of his Manhattan apartment building three weeks after the album's release.

title: John Lennon
text: By 2018, Lennon's solo equivalent album sales had exceeded 72 million units worldwide.

title: John Lennon
text: In 2002, Lennon was voted eighth in a BBC poll of the 100 Greatest Britons, and in 2008, "Rolling Stone" ranked him the fifth-greatest singer of all time.

title: John Lennon
text: In 1987, he was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

title: John Lennon
text: Lennon was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame twice, as a member of the Beatles in 1988 and as a solo artist in 1994.

title: The Warrior and the Slave Girl
text: The Warrior and the Slave Girl is a 1958 Italian- Spanish- French adventure film in Supercinescope and Eastman Color directed by Vittorio Cottafavi.

title: Lew Landers
text: Lew Landers( born Louis Friedlander, January 2, 1901 – December 16, 1962) was an American independent film and television director.

title: The Great Adventures of Captain Kidd
text: The Great Adventures of Captain Kidd( 1953) was the 52nd serial released by Columbia Pictures.

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)
text: " Christmas in My Heart" is a song by German singer – songwriter Sarah Connor.

text: It was her first Christmas single and the lead single from her first Christmas album," Christmas in My Heart"( 2005).

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)
text: Male vocals were provided by Naturally 7 member Dwight Stewart.

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)
text: After the success of" Naughty but Nice", Connor decided to release her first album of Christmas music entitled" Christmas in My Heart".

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)
text: The title track" Christmas in My Heart" was released to promote the album and Connor's tour at the time.

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)
text: The single peaked at number four on the German Singles Chart and was Germany's seventy- seventh best- selling single of 2006.

title: Christmas in My Heart (Sarah Connor song)

title: Giant in My Heart
text: " Giant in My Heart" is a song by Canadian recording artist Kiesza from her debut studio album," Sound of a Woman"( 2014).

title: Giant in My Heart
text: It was released by record label Lokal Legend as the second single from the album on August 8, 2014.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: The song was co-written by Kiesza and Rami Samir Afuni, and produced by the latter.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: " Giant in My Heart" is an electropop and house track sung in an emotive falsetto tone and features a combination of scat- singing, a pounding 808 and softer synth- led sections.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: Lyrically, the song focuses on subjects of love lost and the aftermath of a breakup.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: " Giant in My Heart" garnered positive reviews from contemporary music critics, who commended the song for its sonic similarities with Kiesza's debut single" Hideaway" and the singer's strong vocal performance.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: It was a commercial success, debuting at number four on the UK Singles Chart, number one on the UK Dance Chart and selling 33,414 copies in its first week.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: " Giant in My Heart" marked Kiesza's second consecutive top five single in the United Kingdom and has also had success in Germany and Belgium where it peaked at numbers 11 and 12 respectively.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: The song was accompanied by a short film music video directed by producer Afuni in New York City.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: The clip premiered on July 1, 2014 and was acclaimed by several critics.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: It features a frustrated male office worker living a double life as a crossdresser.

title: Giant in My Heart
text: Kiesza has performed" Giant in My Heart" on American television show" Jimmy Kimmel Live!", and the song has been covered by English singer Florrie.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: " Go Ahead and Break My Heart" is a song that was written and recorded by American singers Blake Shelton and Gwen Stefani for the former's tenth studio album," If I'm Honest"( 2016).

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: Shelton's longtime producer Scott Hendricks produced the track.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: It was released as its second promotional single for digital download on May 9, 2016.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: The song is Shelton and Stefani's first collaboration.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: The ideas behind the song began after the pair shared similar insecurities with each other, leaving Shelton to write the first verse, followed by Stefani analyzing it and writing her own.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: " Go Ahead and Break My Heart" received generally positive reviews from music critics, with them finding it to be a" strong" choice for" If I'm Honest".

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: Several other reviewers appreciated Stefani's contributions to the track.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: It debuted at number 70 on United States'" Billboard" Hot 100 and also managed to peak on the Digital Songs component chart in Canada.

title: Go Ahead and Break My Heart
text: The recording's release was accompanied by two live performances of the song later that day on both" The Voice" and at a promotional i HeartRadio concert.

title: Break My Heart (You Really)

title: Thunder in My Heart (song)

title: Thunder in My Heart (song)

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: Scott R. Dunlap( June 20, 1892 – March 30, 1970) was an American film producer, director, screenwriter, and actor.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: Dunlap was born in Chicago, Illinois in 1892 and entered the film business in 1915.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: He produced 70 films between 1937 and 1960, and directed 47 films between 1919 and 1929.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: In 1942, Dunlap was with Western star Buck Jones at the Cocoanut Grove fire in Boston, Massachusetts.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: Dunlap was hosting a party in Jones's honor at the nightclub.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: Jones died two days after the fire, while Dunlap was seriously hurt, but survived.

title: Scott R. Dunlap
text: Dunlap died in Los Angeles in 1970.

title: Princess Maria Luisa of Savoy (1729–1767)
text: Maria Luisa of Savoy (Maria Luisa Gabriella; 25 March 1729 – 22 June 1767) was a princess of Savoy.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Maria Luisa of Spain (6 July 1782 – 13 March 1824) was a Spanish infanta, daughter of King Charles IV and his wife, Maria Luisa of Parma.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: In 1795, she married her first cousin Louis, Hereditary Prince of Parma.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: She spent the first years of her married life at the Spanish court where their first child, Charles, was born.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: In 1801 the Treaty of Aranjuez made her husband King of Etruria, a kingdom created from the former Duchy of Tuscany in exchange for the renunciation of the Duchy of Parma.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: They arrived in Florence, the capital of the new kingdom, in August 1801.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: During a brief visit to Spain in 1802, Maria Luisa gave birth to her second child.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Her husband's reign in Etruria was marred by his ill health.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: He died in 1803, at the age of 30, following an epileptic crisis.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Maria Luisa acted as regent for their son.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: During her government in Florence, she tried to gain the support of her subjects, but her administration of Etruria was cut short by Napoleon Bonaparte, who forced her to leave with her children in December 1807.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: As part of the Treaty of Fontainebleau, Napoleon incorporated Etruria to his domains.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: After a futile interview with Napoleon in Milan, Maria Luisa looked for refuge in exile with her family in Spain.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: The Spanish court was deeply divided and a month after her arrival the country was thrown into unrest when a popular uprising, known as the Mutiny of Aranjuez, forced Maria Luisa's father to abdicate in favor of her brother Ferdinand VII.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Napoleon invited father and son to Bayonne, France, with the excuse of acting as a mediator, but gave the kingdom to his brother Joseph.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Napoleon called the remaining members of the Spanish royal family to France and at their departure on 2 May 1808, the citizens of Madrid rose up against the French occupation.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: In France, Maria Luisa was reunited in exile with her parents.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: She was the only member of the Spanish royal family to directly oppose Napoleon.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: After her secret plan to escape was discovered, Maria Luisa was separated from her son and placed with her daughter as prisoners in a Roman convent.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Maria Luisa, mostly known as the Queen of Etruria during her lifetime, regained her freedom in 1814 at the fall of Napoleon.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: In the following years she continued to live in Rome, hoping to recover her son's former domains.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: To put forward her case she wrote a book of memoirs, but was disappointed when the Congress of Vienna (1814–15) compensated her not with Parma, but with the smaller Duchy of Lucca, which had been carved out of Tuscany.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: As a consolation she was allowed to retain the honors of a queen.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: Initially reluctant to accept this accord, Maria Luisa did not take the government of Lucca until December 1817.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: As a reigning duchess of Lucca, she disregarded the constitution imposed by the Congress of Vienna.

title: Maria Luisa, Duchess of Lucca
text: While spending time in her palace in Rome, she died of cancer at the age of 41.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: Philip V (19 December 1683 – 9 July 1746) was King of Spain from 1 November 1700 to his abdication in favour of his son Louis on 14 January 1724, and from his reaccession of the throne upon his son's death, 6 September 1724 to his own death on 9 July 1746.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: Before his reign, Philip occupied an exalted place in the royal family of France as a grandson of King Louis XIV.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: His father, Louis, Grand Dauphin, had the strongest genealogical claim to the throne of Spain when it became vacant in 1700.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: However, since neither the Grand Dauphin nor Philip's older brother, Louis, Duke of Burgundy, could be displaced from their place in the succession to the French throne, the Grand Dauphin's maternal uncle (Philip's granduncle)

title: Philip V of Spain
text: King Charles II of Spain named Philip as his heir in his will.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: It was well known that the union of France and Spain under one monarch would upset the balance of power in Europe, such that other European powers would take steps to prevent it.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: Indeed, Philip's accession in Spain provoked the 13-year War of the Spanish Succession, which continued until the Treaty of Utrecht forbade any future possibility of unifying the French and Spanish crowns while confirming his accession to the throne of Spain.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: Philip was the first member of the French House of Bourbon to rule as King of Spain.

title: Philip V of Spain
text: The sum of his two reigns, 45 years and 21 days, is the longest in modern Spanish history.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: Fort Apache is a 1948 American western film directed by John Ford and starring John Wayne and Henry Fonda.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: The film was the first of the director's" cavalry trilogy" and was followed by" She Wore a Yellow Ribbon"( 1949) and" Rio Grande"( 1950), both also starring Wayne.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: The screenplay was inspired by James Warner Bellah's short story" Massacre"( 1947).

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: The historical sources for" Massacre" have been attributed both to George Armstrong Custer and the Battle of Little Bighorn and to the Fetterman Fight.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: The film was one of the first to present an authentic and sympathetic view of the Native Americans.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: In his review of the DVD release of" Fort Apache" in 2012," New York Times" movie critic

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: Dave Kehr called it" one of the great achievements of classical American cinema, a film of immense complexity that never fails to reveal new shadings with each viewing ... among the first pro-Indian westerns" that portrays the Native Americans with" sympathy and respect".

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: The film was awarded the Best Director and Best Cinematography awards by the Locarno International Film Festival of Locarno, Switzerland.

title: Fort Apache (film)
text: Screenwriter Frank S. Nugent was nominated for best screenplay by the Writers Guild of America.

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
text: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon is a 1949 Technicolor Western film directed by John Ford and starring John Wayne.

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
text: The Oscar- winning film was the second of Ford's Cavalry trilogy films, along with" Fort Apache"( 1948) and" Rio Grande"( 1950).

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
text: With a budget of$ 1.6 million, the film was one of the most expensive Westerns made up to that time.

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
text: It was a major hit for RKO.

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
text: The film takes its name from" She Wore a Yellow Ribbon", a popular US military song that is used to keep marching cadence.

title: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon

title: William II, Count of Flanders
text: Margaret inherited Flanders and Hainault in 1244 and immediately the War of the Succession of Flanders and Hainault began between William and his brothers, the Dampierre claimants, and the children of Margaret's first marriage to Bouchard of Avesnes.

title: William II, Count of Flanders
text: Margaret favoured William and declared him her heir.

title: William II, Count of Flanders
text: In 1246, Louis IX of France intervened to arbitrate the conflict and declared Flanders to William and Hainault to John I of Avesnes.

title: William II, Count of Flanders
text: Margaret officially invested William as count in 1247.

text: In November of that year, William married Beatrice of Brabant, daughter of Henry II, Duke of Brabant and Marie of Hohenstaufen.

title: William II, Count of Flanders
text: They had no children.

text: Meanwhile, the fight continued over Namur between the Dampierres and the Avesnes.

title: Lee Mantle
text: Lee Mantle( December 13, 1851 November 18, 1934) was a United States Senator from Montana.

title: Lee Mantle
text: Born in Birmingham, England, his mother converted to Mormonism and immigrated to the United States with her children; they settled at Salt Lake City, Utah in 1864.

title: Lee Mantle
text: Upon arriving in Utah Territory and facing evidence that Mormon men were practicing polygamy, Mantle's mother came to believe that she had been deceived by the Mormon missionaries and she and her children renounced the LDS Church.

title: Lee Mantle
text: Mantle attended a village school and moved to Idaho Territory in 1870, where he was a telegraph operator and stage agent.

title: Lee Mantle
text: He moved to Butte, Montana in 1877 and became agent of the Wells- Fargo Express Co.

title: Lee Mantle
text: He established the Inter Mountain, a daily Republican newspaper, in 1881 and served as alderman the same year.

title: Lee Mantle
text: He was a member of the Territorial house of representatives in 1882, 1884, and 1888, and served as speaker in 1888; he was mayor of Butte in 1892 and many times chairman of local and State conventions.

title: Lee Mantle
text: Lee Mantle was appointed to the U.S. Senate to fill the vacancy in the term commencing March 4, 1893, caused by the failure of the legislature to elect, but was not seated; he was then elected as a Republican to fill the vacancy and served from January 16, 1895 to March 3, 1899.

title: Lee Mantle
text: In 1896, he switched parties and joined the Silver Republican Party.

title: Lee Mantle
text: He was an unsuccessful candidate for renomination in 1899, and organized and became chairman of the Silver Republican Party of Montana in 1896, but returned to the Republican Party in 1900.

title: Lee Mantle
text: He was manager and part- time editor of the Inter Mountain until 1901 and also engaged in the real estate and mining business.

title: Lee Mantle
text: In 1921, he moved to Los Angeles, California and died there in 1934; he was interred in Mount Moriah Cemetery, Butte.

title: Yi Bong-chool
text: Yi Bong-chool or Lee Bong-chool( 1925–1992) was an officer for the Republic of Korea.

title: Silas Hardy
text: Silas Hardy( 30 April 1867 – 27 June 1905) was an English cricketer.

title: Silas Hardy
text: Hardy was a right- arm fast- medium bowler, although which hand he batted with is unknown.

title: Silas Hardy

title: Silas Hardy

title: Silas Hardy

title: Silas Hardy
text: In his 5 first- class matches, he scored 45 runs at a batting average of 9.00, with a high score of 12*.

title: Silas Hardy
text: With the ball he took 4 wickets at a bowling average of 68.50, with best figures of 2/100.

title: Silas Hardy
text: He died at Kimberley, Nottinghamshire on 27 June 1905.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan Carlos I( Juan Carlos Alfonso Víctor María de Borbón y Borbón- Dos Sicilias, born 5 January 1938) is a member of the Spanish royal family who reigned as King of Spain from November 1975 until his abdication in June 2014.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan Carlos is the grandson of Alfonso XIII, the last king of Spain before the abolition of the monarchy in 1931 and the subsequent declaration of the Second Spanish Republic.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan Carlos was born in Rome, Italy, during his family's exile.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: " Generalísimo" Francisco Franco took over the government of Spain after his victory in the Spanish Civil War in 1939, yet in 1947 Spain's status as a monarchy was affirmed and a law was passed allowing Franco to choose his successor.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan Carlos's father, Juan, was the third son of King Alfonso, who had renounced his claims to the throne in January 1941.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan was seen by Franco to be too liberal and in 1969 was bypassed in favour of Juan Carlos as Franco's successor as head of state.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Juan Carlos spent his early years in Italy and came to Spain in 1947 to continue his studies.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: After completing his secondary education in 1955, he began his military training and entered the General Military Academy at Zaragoza.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Later, he attended the Naval Military School, the General Academy of the Air, and finished his tertiary education at the University of Madrid.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: In 1962, Juan Carlos married Princess Sophia of Greece and Denmark in Athens.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: The couple had two daughters and a son together: Elena, Cristina, and Felipe.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Due to Franco's declining health, Juan Carlos first began periodically acting as Spain's head of state in the summer of 1974.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Franco died in November the following year and Juan Carlos became king on 22 November 1975, two days after Franco's death, the first reigning monarch since 1931; although his exiled father did not formally renounce his claims to the throne in favor of his son until 1977.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Expected to continue Franco's legacy, Juan Carlos, however, soon after his accession introduced reforms to dismantle the Francoist regime and begin the Spanish transition to democracy.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: This led to the approval of the Spanish Constitution of 1978 in a referendum, which re-established a constitutional monarchy.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: In 1981, Juan Carlos played a major role in preventing a coup that attempted to revert Spain to Francoist government in the King's name.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: In 2008, he was considered the most popular leader in all Ibero- America.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: Hailed for his role in Spain's transition to democracy, the King and the monarchy's reputation began to suffer after controversies surrounding his family arose, exacerbated by an elephant- hunting trip he undertook during a time of financial crisis in Spain.

title: Juan Carlos I of Spain
text: In 2014, Juan Carlos, citing personal reasons, abdicated in favour of his son, who acceded to the throne as Felipe VI.

title: Juan Carlos Pérez Frías
text: Juan Carlos Pérez Frías( born 27 July 1956), known as Juan Carlos, is a Spanish former professional footballer who played as a midfielder.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Juan Carlos Salazar is a well known Venezuelan singer and cuatro player.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Juan Carlos was born in , a small oil town in the State of Monagas.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Born to a singer, guitarist and cuatro player, Juan Carlos learned how to play cuatro and guitar by ear at an early age and took piano lessons in Fort Collins, Colorado. Juan Carlos Salazar actually began his singing career by accident.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: While in high school he was selected to play the “cuatro” for a fellow student who was to represent their school in a nationwide singing competition.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Three days before the big event, the singer developed an acute case of laryngitis.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Too late to retire the school from the contest, the principal searched desperately for a replacement.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: The only student that knew the song was Juan Carlos.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: At the age of 16, without ever taking a singing lesson, Juan Carlos walked to the center of the stage and trembling all over sang the song.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Upsetting all the favorites, Juan Carlos won first prize and national recognition.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Juan Carlos is an accomplished performer with over twenty years of experience.

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: He has performed internationally to “standing room only crowds” and in intimate settings in Venezuela, Dominican Republic, San Diego (CA), Miami, Orlando, Gainesville and Tampa (FL), Denver and Fort Collins (CO), San Juan (PR), Madrid (Spain), Bonn and Stuttgart (Germany), Brussels (Belgium), The Hague (Netherlands), Paris (France), London (England), Zurich and Berna (Switzerland).

title: Juan Carlos Salazar
text: Since 2009 he lives currently in Orlando, Florida State.

title: Marie Colvin
text: Marie Catherine Colvin (January 12, 1956 – February 22, 2012) was a British/American journalist who worked as a foreign affairs correspondent for the British newspaper "The Sunday Times" from 1985 until her death.

title: Marie Colvin
text: She died while covering the siege of Homs in Syria.

title: Marie Colvin
text: After her death, Stony Brook University established the Marie Colvin Center for International Reporting in her honor.

title: Marie Colvin
text: Her family also established the Marie Colvin Memorial Fund through the Long Island Community Foundation, which strives to give donations in Marie's name in honor of her humanitarianism.

title: Marie Colvin
text: In July 2016, lawyers representing Colvin's family filed a civil action against the government of the Syrian Arab Republic claiming they had obtained proof that the Syrian government had directly ordered her assassination, leading to a judge finding the Syrian government guilty of her assassination in early 2019, awarding Colvin's family $302 million in damages.

title: Juan Carlos Gumucio

title: Namie Amuro
text: Born in Naha, Okinawa, Japan, Amuro debuted as the lead singer of the idol group Super Monkey's when she was 14 years old.

title: Namie Amuro
text: Despite early sales disappointments, she ventured into modeling and acting, attracting domestic attention with the group's best-selling single

title: Namie Amuro
text: "Try Me (Watashi o Shinjite)".

title: Namie Amuro
text: She signed to Avex Trax in 1995 and debuted as a solo artist with the single "Body Feels Exit".

title: Namie Amuro
text: Her 1996 studio album, "Sweet 19 Blues," sold over 3 million copies, setting the record at the time for the biggest selling album by a female artist in Japan and the highest selling album debut in the world (currently ranked #15 in the world's largest first week album sales).

title: Namie Amuro
text: One of the singles from her album "Concentration 20" (1997), "Can You Celebrate?", is the best-selling single by a solo female artist in Japanese music history.

title: Namie Amuro
text: From 1999, Amuro partnered with international musicians and producers on her records, beginning with "Genius 2000" (2000).

title: Namie Amuro
text: In the early 2000s, Amuro's music evolved from pop to R&B, and Amuro saw a decline in sales.

title: Namie Amuro
text: "Play" (2007), her eighth studio album, heralded a period of commercial resurgence.

title: Namie Amuro
text: She continued to experiment musically, moving to electronic dance music and English language songs with follow-up records "Uncontrolled" (2012) and "Feel" (2013).

title: Namie Amuro
text: She subsequently released her eleventh studio album, "Genic" (2015) and a compilation album, "Finally" (2017).

title: Namie Amuro
text: Amuro is noted within the Japanese entertainment industry, and the wider Western music industry, for "producing" and managing her own career.

title: Namie Amuro
text: Aside from music, she has appeared in various advertisement campaigns in Japan and founded her own management company, Stella88, and her own record label, Dimension Point.

title: Namie Amuro
text: Having sold more than 36 million records in Japan, Amuro is recognized as one of the best-selling artists in Japan by Oricon.

title: Namie Amuro
text: Since her solo debut, she has top 10 singles for 23 consecutive years (#1 for solo artist).

title: Namie Amuro
text: All of her albums are at least certified Platinum, and her debut solo album, "Sweet 19 Blues", was the best selling album in Japan.

title: Namie Amuro
text: She is the only artist in Japan selling million albums in her teens, 20s, 30s and 40s.

title: Namie Amuro
text: Furthermore, her last album, "Finally", topped the Year-End album charts of both Oricon and Billboard Japan for two consecutive years (The first and only artist in the Japanese Music Industry to do so).

title: Namie Amuro
text: Amuro has frequently been noted for her live performances at music award ceremonies and she is the recipient of World Music Awards, Japan Record Awards, Japan Gold Disc Awards, and MTV Video Music Awards Japan among many others.

title: Namie Amuro
text: On September 16, 2018, Amuro officially retired from the music and entertainment business.

title: Heaven (Namie Amuro song)

title: Heaven (Namie Amuro song)
text: Japanese recording artist Namie Amuro from her eleventh studio album and second bilingual album "Feel" (2013).

title: Heaven (Namie Amuro song)
text: The song was released as the album's lead promotional single on July 10, 2013, the same release date as "FeelHeaven" was written by Emyli and produced by German-Russian DJ Zedd.

title: Heaven (Namie Amuro song)
text: Heaven" was included on two of Amuro's concert tours, the "Namie Amuro Feel 2013 Tour" and "Namie Amuro Live Style 2014".

title: Guy of Ibelin, seneschal of Cyprus
text: ( French:" Guy d' Ibelin")( before 1306 – 1350/60) was seneschal of Cyprus from 1318 and a burgher of Venice from 30 December 1334.

title: Guy of Ibelin, seneschal of Cyprus
text: He was the son of Philip of Ibelin( 1253 –1318), previous seneschal of Cyprus and Jerusalem by his second wife Maria of Giblet( d. 1331).

title: Guy of Ibelin, seneschal of Cyprus

text: He married Margaret of Ibelin with papal dispensation in 1319.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: The Dillinger Escape Plan is an American mathcore band from Morris Plains, New Jersey.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Formed in 1997, the group originally featured vocalist Dimitri Minakakis, lead guitarist Ben Weinman, rhythm guitarist Derek Brantley, bassist Adam Doll and drummer Chris Pennie, although Brantley left after only two shows.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: The remaining four members recorded the band's self-titled debut EP in 1997, before John Fulton replaced Brantley for the subsequent tour and 1998's "Under the Running Board".

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Shortly after the second EP's release, Fulton left the band due to "creative differences", and in early 1999 Doll was forced to cease involvement due to a spinal injury suffered in a road traffic accident.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: As a result, Weinman performed all guitars and bass on the band's full-length debut album "Calculating Infinity", released in 1999.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Following the release of "Calculating Infinity", Brian Benoit replaced Fulton and Jeff Wood took Doll's place; Wood left the band in 2000 due to the ongoing effects of a gunshot wound to the head sustained in 1992, and was replaced by Liam Wilson.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: In April 2001, it was announced that Minakakis had decided to leave The Dillinger Escape Plan to pursue "non-music related endeavors", with the band briefly placed on hiatus.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: The vocalist was replaced later in the year by Greg Puciato, who was chosen from "over one hundred" singers who auditioned by submitting a recording of "43% Burnt" to the band.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: In between the departure of Minakakis and the addition of Puciato, the band recorded the EP

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: "Irony Is a Dead Scene" with Faith No More and

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Mr. Bungle vocalist Mike Patton, which was released in 2002.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: In 2004, the band released its first album with Puciato on vocals, "Miss Machine".

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Later in the year, Benoit suffered nerve damage in his left hand which affected his ability to play guitar; after attempting to continue, he was forced to leave the band in April 2005 and was replaced by James Love.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: During a tour in 2006, tensions arose between Weinman and Pennie, with the guitarist briefly leaving the band citing "undisclosed personal reasons".

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Pennie eventually left the band in 2007 to join Coheed and Cambria, with Gil Sharone replacing him for the band's third album "Ire Works".

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Also in 2007, guitarist Jeff Tuttle was added to the band due to Love's unavailability.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: By the beginning of 2009, Sharone had left the band and been replaced by Billy Rymer. "

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Option Paralysis" was released in 2010, which marked Tuttle's first contribution to the band (he performed additional vocals, with Weinman recording all guitars).

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: The guitarist later left the band in August 2012 to attend film school.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: Love rejoined the band as Tuttle's replacement, although was not featured on the 2013 album "

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: One of Us Is the Killer".

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: After a brief hiatus, Love was replaced by Kevin Antreassian in 2015.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: The band released "Dissociation" in 2016, which was presented as the group's final album before embarking on an indefinite hiatus the following year.

title: List of The Dillinger Escape Plan band members
text: In the liner notes of "Dissociation" the band listed everyone who was a member or a part of the band in some other way or another.

text: The list states "

text: The Dillinger Escape Plan is: Billy Rymer, Greg Puciato, Liam Wilson, Benjamin Weinman, Kevin Antreassian, Dimitri Minakakis, Adam Doll, Brian Benoit, Chris Pennie, Tom Apostolopoulos, Jeff Wood, John Fulton, Jeff Tuttle, Mike Patton, Thomas Bouaziz, Kevin Hilliard, Gil Sharone, James Love, Jessica Curreri, Steve Evetts, Talmadge Cook, Ryan Downey, Jeff Geisser, Brian Montouri, Paul D'Elia, Chris Tropea, Asian Steve, Timothy Connors, Matt Rosenblum, Reid Ferris, Marc Schapiro, And all the other fearless soldiers who have graced the stage with us over the past 20 years."
